---
title: "Casting Integers"
date: 2018-12-17T14:25:20+01:00
draft: true
---

```
olehermanse@OHMBP-1777 core $ cat test.c
#include <stdio.h>

int main(void)
{
  for (size_t i = 1; i != 0; ++i)
  {
    int c = i;
    if (c == 0)
    {
      printf("(%zX) %zu -> %d\n", i, i, c);
    }
  }
  return 0;
}
olehermanse@OHMBP-1777 core $ gcc -O3 test.c -o test && ./test
(100000000) 4294967296 -> 0
(200000000) 8589934592 -> 0
(300000000) 12884901888 -> 0
(400000000) 17179869184 -> 0
(500000000) 21474836480 -> 0
(600000000) 25769803776 -> 0
(700000000) 30064771072 -> 0
(800000000) 34359738368 -> 0
(900000000) 38654705664 -> 0
(A00000000) 42949672960 -> 0
(B00000000) 47244640256 -> 0
(C00000000) 51539607552 -> 0
(D00000000) 55834574848 -> 0
(E00000000) 60129542144 -> 0
(F00000000) 64424509440 -> 0
(1000000000) 68719476736 -> 0
(1100000000) 73014444032 -> 0
(1200000000) 77309411328 -> 0
(1300000000) 81604378624 -> 0
(1400000000) 85899345920 -> 0
(1500000000) 90194313216 -> 0
(1600000000) 94489280512 -> 0
(1700000000) 98784247808 -> 0
(1800000000) 103079215104 -> 0
(1900000000) 107374182400 -> 0
(1A00000000) 111669149696 -> 0
(1B00000000) 115964116992 -> 0
(1C00000000) 120259084288 -> 0
(1D00000000) 124554051584 -> 0
(1E00000000) 128849018880 -> 0
```
